newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS-Earnings swing share prices.
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS-Earnings swing share prices.

text.p: BAY NETWORKS INC up 3 to 32-5/16

Stock touched a new year high of $33 in heavy trading after it posted better-than-expected earnings for its fiscal fourth quarter, showing the first signs that a new strategy from a new chief executive is working. The third-largest independent maker of computer networking gear said it had profit from operations of $30.5 million or $0.15 a share before a charge compared to oper net of $55.1 million or $0.28 a share last year.
WASTE MANAGEMENT INC up 3/16 to 31

The stock one of the most heavily traded on the NYSE after the largest U.S. hauler and handler of garbage posted second quarter net income of $180 million or $0.41 a share, below last year's earnings. Wall Street analysts had expected earnings of $0.44 a share, according to First Call.
DUPONT CO up 1-5/16 to 67-3/8
The chemical and energy company said it is "well on the way" to a record year after posting earnings of $1.01 a share compared to $0.89 for the same period last year.
COMPUTER ASSOCIATES INTL INC up 4-6/16 to 68-11/16

The stock touched a new 52-week high of $70 after the third-largest independent software firm said fiscal Q1 earnings jumped 30 percent on strong sales of its computer network management software. Net income for the quarter ended June 30 rose to $0.42 a share from $0.32 last year. First Call said Wall Street analysts expected earnings of $0.39 a share.
NS GROUP INC +3-5/8 to 18-3/4

Shares jumped 24 percent after the maker of tubular bar steel products posted a third quarter profit of $0.34 a share late after the market close on Tuesday compared to a loss of $0.14 a share in the year-ago period.
KNOLL INC +2-9/16 to 29-1/16

Knoll's net income of $0.41 a share jumped 110 percent from $0.19 a share it earned last year, both on a pro forma basis. It was the first earnings earnings report from the office furniture maker since its May IPO.
NAM TAI ELECTRONICS INC + 3-3/4 to 24-1/2

Shares jumped nearly 20 percent after the Vancouver firm's earnings blew past Wall Street estimates. Q2 EPS were US$0.97 a share compared to US$0.17, coming in 155 percent above estimates of $0.40, according to Zacks investment research.
SPINE TECH INC +7-1/2 to 54-1/2

Shares jumped 15 percent and touched a new high of 55-1/4 after the Minneapolis company said it earned $0.25 in the second quarter, a dime more than estimates of $0.15. It also won regulatory clearance for a laparoscopic procedure.
DELTEK SYSTEMS INC up 2-3/8 to 19-3/8

Shares jumped after the McClean, Va. company earned $0.14 a share compared to $0.04 last year, 50 percent above forecasts of $0.09 a share. The company makes a family of integrated software tools for project-oriented businesses.

The stock has turned in quite a performance in its first six months as a publicly traded company since its IPO in February. Despite a slip on its first day of trading, the stock is up 75 percent over its IPO price of $11.
